project.title: The Blind King
project.description:
For my graduation project I decided to create this real-time character, rendered in Unreal Engine 4.

My main goal was to create a character from a challenging and detailed concept, and bring something new to my portfolio. This is unlike any character I've ever made, and I've learned many lessons from the crazy challenges I encountered! :D
.
Thanks to Vincent Steenstra Toussaint, for blessing my project with his incredible audio magic!
And thanks to Tooth Wu for allowing me to use his awesome concept of Blind King:
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/XnaGOn

project.title: Realistic Creature Texturing Painting Tutorial Using Mari | Available now!
project.description:
I wanted to make this creature texturing course to help people wanting  to start out in the vfx industry. I carefully structured this course to be of the highest of quality that you’d expect as a full standalone creature texturing module in a university.

*****GUMROAD LINK*****
http://bit.ly/3dc9Jk7​
          
What is this course?
This is a pre-recorded online texturing course, with each step recorded and structured into bite size chapters. Going from preparing a model for texturing - through to exporting final textures out of Mari.

In the VFX industry it's almost impossible to be given an asset without photo reference to work towards, and this course will focus on creating photo-realistic textures. We won't be creating these textures from our head, we'll be referencing photography though the entire process to give us direction and inspiration. We’ll talk extensively on how to break down this photography and building the textures based on your own observations, to come up with a plan for how we will approach the asset. 


I just want to say a big thank you to Penggao Yu - he is the talented modeller who sculpted this crocodile. Check him out!

artstation.com/yupenggao

*****GUMROAD LINK*****
http://bit.ly/3dc9Jk7​

project.title: Bakery
project.description:
I try to learn more and more software and make my projects bigger every time. For this one, I decided to make a real-time rendering on Unreal Engine for the first time. I've learned how to use the software's basics entirely by myself. I know I still have a lot to learn and I'm determined to develop even more skills in the future. 


I conceptualized this Bakery myself, and it started with a chalkboard sign in front of a restaurant which inspired me.

project.title: Welcome to Strixhaven
project.description:
My first ever release for Magic: The Gathering! It has been a very very long journey to get here, one that had some serious highs and lows. I think everyone knows that feeling of sending a portfolio in time and time again and just getting nothing in return... its tough. After years of trying to keep my head down and keep the grind going we got there. WOTC just put out this piece which is one of the promo pieces for Strixhaven! Super pumped.. the art that is coming with this set is totally insane.. and the artists working on it are unbelievable. I can only hope I did the art they are creating a little but of justice with this one. I also including some process down below! thanks so much everyone!

AD: Brad Thompson
Client : Wizards of the Coast 2020

project.title: Car: Pagani Huayra (Canopy Door)
project.description:
I modeled this hyper car "Huayra" of Pagani Automobili in 2017. Then Recently I refined the old model and added some modification (over fender, bumper,  diffuser).

In the process of customization, I referred to the appearance of Lockheed's SR-71 blackbird for this canopy door and huge rear wing.

rendered in EEVEE or Cycles

Anyway, I hope you enjoy playing this special event mode as much as we do.  ^^

project.title: Sankari Village
project.description:
Here is a village I created for a game assignment in school last year, and after my thesis I had some time to polish it up! I used a modular workflow for the houses, and created Substance Designer materials and shaders for a faster workflow. The village in whole took me less than a month to create in Unreal Engine 4.

A big thank you to Jeryce for mentoring me throughout the project!

project.title: Howard-Lee-I-SEEAnimated-Music-Video
project.description:
《I see》是李浩瑋Howard Lee個人首張專輯『Diamond in the rough』的單曲，描繪了自己小至過去所發生種種的錯誤，大至世界上所發生的歷史悲劇，因為沒有任何人能改變過去，在檢討自己的過程中所產生的焦慮以及無助，在與自己獨處時要面對自己的心魔，閉上眼睛會看到的是自己不想面對的過去。
只有時間能忘記一切，但不一定能被原諒。

project.title: Stroem
project.description:
Strøm—a homage to Raawii and Vilhelm Lundstrøm.

As fans of Vilhelm Lundstrøm’s work, we immediately fell in love with the Raawii Strøm Collection by Danish designer Nicholas Wiig Hansen. 

The clean geometric shapes and bright colors inspired us to create a homage where each object of the collection is treated as a character with it’s own characteristics. 

The result is a colorful and surreal world where ceramics come to life—one by one.

Concept and 3D by PomPom
Collection design by Nicholas Wiig Hansen
Sound design by Povel Olsson

project.title: Amazon-Halo
project.description: This project is an interesting case study in adaptability. Amazon initially came to us to help make auxiliary videos to help support a live action product launch for their new Halo device. But then the pandemic hit and live action was suddenly off the table — Amazon was left in the lurch. If only they knew a full-service animation studio who could still deliver the goods...

project.title: Brabham-shading
project.description: This project is a small part of a big personal cgi challenge i'm doing currently and it is my first car render. I did all the shading of the car procedurally inside 3DS Max and i used V-Ray. It took more than i expected to finish it, considering it is a side personal project. I will probably work on it more in the future but now it works for its purpose and it is time to keep going with the main scene i'm making.\nThe car is a free model made by Szymon Kubicki: https:\/\/www.behance.net\/kubicki3d
